intro: Centaurea corymbosa, commonly known as the common centaury, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features bright yellow flowers with red or purple centers. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and branching. Centaurea corymbosa is often found in meadows, grasslands, and along roadsides, and it is known for its ornamental value in gardens.
